bool checkMemoryAccess ( REG  index  ) 

Checks whether the given index is legal for access to the memory.

Returns:
true if the access is legal.

REG* getDestinationParameter ( SIVM *  sivm,
cmd_word *  word 
)

Computes the destination from a command word. WARNING: updates PC if necessary

Parameters:
sivm the VM in which to get the parameters
word the command word from which to compute parameters
dest pointer to the pointer to the destination parameter
Returns:
a pointer to the destination operand, possibly null if the mode encoded in the given word is illegal

bool increment_PC ( SIVM *  sivm  ) 

Handles PC incrementation for an SIVM. Also checks for PC validity, which is why you shouldn't increment PC by hand.

Returns:
false if PC can't be incremented anymore (ie current PC >= MEMSIZE)

Definition at line 106 of file sivm.c.

References checkMemoryAccess(), logm(), and SIVM::pc.

Referenced by getDestinationParameter(), getSourceParameter(), and sivm_step().

bool sivm_exec ( SIVM *  sivm,
cmd_word *  word 
)

Executes the given word in the given SIVM. Checks for invalid adressing modes. WARNING: may update PC through calls to getSourceParameter and getDestinationParameter.

See also:
getSourceParameter

getDestinationParameter

Returns:
true if the instruction was correctly executed.

bool sivm_load ( SIVM *  sivm,
int  memsize,
cmd_word  mem[memsize] 
)

Loads the given program in the given SIVM.

Returns:
false if the SIVM's memory is too small to load the whole program, true if the loading was successful.

void sivm_new ( SIVM *  sivm  ) 

Initializes a new ProcSI virtual machine.

Initializes an SIVM. Inits PC, SP and SR registers to the values defined in the SIVM.h file. Inits all memory and registers of the SIVM to 0.

bool sivm_step ( SIVM *  sivm  ) 

Executes the next instruction in the given SIVM.

See also:
sivm_exec

increment_PC

Returns:
true if the instruction was correctly executed, false if the SIVM has to stop (whether on HALT instruction or because of a bad instruction).
